Posts.Content: Hi. I finished fec-t chemo middle of November and my hair definitely started growing during tax. My daughter took a picture of it in chemo Unit to show me as I didn't really believe her. I didn't lose it all. Had a fine layer all over top of head. I also started herceptin at the same time as tax and was told my hair would regrow slowly until herceptin had finished. I am now 7 weeks post chemo and have short hair growing all over my head but shorter on top. I can still see my scalp. Bit fluffy near the crown and have to use a bit of gel now to stick it down a bit. Chin Hair back with a vengeance and under arm hair just sprouting very fine hair. Didn't lose brows and lashes just went really thin and fine. They still look the same at the moment.  If I don't pay much attention to my hair it is seems to grow quicker lol.i don't wear head covering very often as find it itchy so I often have people wanting to touch my new baby hair as well. I find myself rubbing my hands through it whilst watching TV at night.  It does feel silky soft. You will get there.  Tracey
Posts.Title: Want hair back

Posts.Content: Hi Mandy I am exactly the same with my big toes. Hardly been able to walk or sleep this week. Even bedding to heavy for my poor toes. I was in the middle of radiotherapy  (just finished on Wednesday) Been a struggle to get something on my feet to get there. Have a bad chest infection as well. I thought my toe nails were starting to go ingrown and that was causing the inflammation and pain. After radiotherapy on Wednesday my feet and chest were so bad the radiologist examined me and said the brown toes were definitely caused by docetaxal. I'm on strong antibiotics and steroids. My toes feel much easier today and the infection has popped so pressure released. Seeing GP tomorrow so will ask about ongoing care incase they get bad again. Have lost 1 nail on 3rd toe but no pain with that. If you still have trouble with them you can ask radiologist as they are still oncology doctors.  I haven't repainted them now. Just moisturiser on my dry heals. Good luck Tracey x
Posts.Title: Toenails - Yuck!

Posts.Content: Hi loolyboo I feel exactly the same. Aching all through my back round my thighs and down to my knees. My feet hurt as well. I am only 11 days past last chemo so thought it was the docetaxal although I haven't had these aches before. Only had 3 herceptin so not sure which side effects are from what. Have planning meeting for radiotherapy on Wednesday and was expecting to feel better by now not worse. Could also be my white blood cells making up again as they were low. I was told the side effects from herceptin were minimal and get better after the first few. Will have a word with the team on Wednesday if no better and see what they say. My 1st herceptin with the home care team is on 9th Dec. 1st one without chemo so hoping to improve. Maybe you could call the team or bcn for advice.  Hope it doesn't last muchi longer Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Herceptin Injection

Posts.Content: Hi worried. Start mine on Thursday.  Still have some chemo/steroid weight to get rid of and not moving much at the moment with bad feet and chest infection. Hopefully when we are back in our feet the weight gain will be minimal. Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and weight gain

Posts.Content: Hi. I also went on a look good feel better course yesterday at City hospital Nottingham. I found it very helpful and met more people in the same situation at the Maggies centre, and of course the goodie bag was really good. Full of expensive skin products and make up. Was helpful to learn how to draw false eyebrows as I'm not very good with that sort of thing. I was told we are allowed to go to 2 of these throughout the course of treatment. Good luck with your hair. Mine is almost gone after 2 rounds of fec but I don't mind x Tracey
Posts.Title: Help with hair thinning

Posts.Content: Hi.  It looks like my onc. Will be swapping my tamoxifen for letrozole next week as I will have done 2 years on it and they think it is best to change to post menopausal meds. Does anyone know if you have a break in between or if you just change straight over.   Must say I'm really not looking forward to it. Thanks Tracey
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. Hope you all had as decent a Christmas as possible. I would like some advice regarding my toes. I am almost 6 weeks post fec-t and my big toe nails are extremely painful at the top edges. I have suffered with them before but usually if I cut the corners off they are ok.  Now they are throbbing all the time. Painful to walk and even the quilt on them hurts in bed. I've lost one nail on another toe but not painful now. My skin is peeling on my heals so using lots of moisturiser. My heals underneath feel bruised if I've been standing or walking for a while. Just soaked my feet and could cry with the pain. Feel I need to get them checked out but not sure whether to go to chiropodist or GP first. Almost wish they would fall off to ease the pain. I think I thought after 3rd week of recovery I would bounce back but am still struggling. I am aching in my back and legs if I've been busy. Still feels like flu.  My tongue still seems to be giving out that horrid taste when I try to eat. I get tired quickly but try to push through it and end up feeling like I'm 80. I have my 5th herceptin on Friday. Could any of these side effects be from that. I hope not as I have 13 more to go. Had 10 radiotherapy so far and will start tamoxifen beginning Jan.  Everyone seems to think I should be fine now and asking if I'm going back to work after Christmas. Want to punch them lol. I have an appointment with my GP on 9th Jan.  Not been to doctors for years so don't know how that will go. Already had 7 months off work and feel really guilty now. Sorry for the long post. Been trying go stay strong and get on with things and hold the tears in for the last few months but getting harder to carry on coping. My husband and family have been brilliant but don't want to keep moaning about everything so try not to say too much. On a lighter note my oven and hob broke whilst cooking Christmas dinner so won't be cooking this week. Lol. Any advice welcome. Thank you Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Side effects of fec-t on feet and body

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your replies. I will definitely get my big toe nails and feet checked out so I know what I'm dealing with. Hadn't  really thought about hands and fingers but have noticed  finger ends get sore and tender after cleaning or preparing food. I use moisturiser all the time and try to wear socks in bed but they still rub on toes. Wish it was flip flop weather lol. Looks like I'll be hobbling around for a while yet. Got rads tomorrow so will ask for some advice . Sorry for you all still suffering months after chemo ends. Then comes the joys of tamoxifen.  Starting to understand why people say goodbye to the old you and get used to the new very changed you. Take care  Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Side effects of fec-t on feet and body

Posts.Content: Hi 4paws. I had double breast reduction when lump was removed so had surgery to both breasts and SNB. The nurses didn't ask me about surgery just picked best available vein. I had 4 in my left hand (only 1 fec ) The T didn't affect the vein at all. I just kept massaging my forearm and it is improving now. I have herceptin injections in my leg at home now and it's fine. Only takes 5 mins. Then the nurses just sit and chat for 2 hours. I found T very different to fec. Biggest difference being no nausea at all. General achey feeling and wooly head. Never had a temperature but had a couple of nasty chest infections. Good luck with the rest of your treatment but do talk to your onc or nurse re vein pain xx
Posts.Title: Arm pain after Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi JustLittleMe.  I had my cancer removed and double breast reduction in may and SNB in June.  The biopsy was fine. Just a short op as a day case. I had the blue dye put in on the day of surgery. It does give you a partial blue boob and takes a while to disappear (mine is still quite blue) as they only took 1 node I had no problems with movement pain or lymphoma. I have a small scar low down under armpit and have almost forgotten about it. They will give you some arm exercises but I had full movement almost immediately. Just didn't lift heavy things for a while. The first wee after the operation was very very blue (at first I thought it was blue toilet cleaner lol) in my defence I was still a bit woozy from anesthetic.  The surgeon will explain things to you and the aftercare will be given to you when you are discharged. Hope all goes ok Tracey
Posts.Title: After sentinel lymph node biopsy

Posts.Content: Hi I was told the same. I'm mildly asthmatic and half way through chemo and was told to have my flu jab on week 3 of chemo as waiting until November could cause more problems. Traceyxxx
Posts.Title: Flu jab and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi 4 paws. Did you have your chemo through a cannula? I had quite bad pain in my arm after 2nd fec. It was vein pain from cannula site up the middle of my forearm then round to the inside of my elbow. I had to insist that the last fec was done in other hand. Onc told me that fec is worst on vein and T is much better. Seems to be right as I had the last fec and all T in the left hand and it was much better. My right hand and arm still feel tight and tender sometimes. No shoulder pain though. Hope you get it sorted soon. Xxx
Posts.Title: Arm pain after Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Alison.  The pain was much less than I was expecting.  Very doable. Just took ibuprofen for a while.  I just did as I was told with lifting and heavy housework for a while and my bcn fitted me with a very sturdy bra which helped immensely.  It wasn't  pretty but did the job. I now wear m and s post surgery bras and they give me a great shape. There is light at the end of the tunnel and you will get there. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi. I started tamoxifen in January. I also have wockhardt brand. I just write the brand on my repeat prescription and the pharmacy have been good with getting the same brand for me. I take mine in the morning and have mild sweats in the evening but are getting less just lately. No bone or joint pain and not really noticed mood swings. As at menopause age would probably be going through the same thing anyway. Good luck Tracey x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi Alison.  Sorry you are so sad at the the moment. I was also a larger breasted lady E/F cup. I had a lumpectomy on my cancer side  (just above the bra wire in the middle). My surgeon told me this was the perfect place for a breast reduction and was happy to reduce both at the same surgery.  I too was horrified when I saw the result. Black and blue swollen squashed and misshapen.  I had a big necrosis on my right nipple as well as a blue nipple on the left side from the node biopsy. My family thought my new boobs were great as they were still me and I kept both my nipples as well. That was may this year. They have now settled down really well. No one knows if I have a bra on or not. They are higher up and am still a D cup. Body shape is obviously different especially with weight gain with this chemo but I've almost forgotten I've had them done now. My nipples are still numb but the rest of my scars are small and pink. Takes a while for them to thaw out lol.  Please try and take it one day at a time. Another bonus of the reduction is less back ache.  Hope you have a better day. Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi. I started tamoxifen in January. I also have wockhardt brand. I just write the brand on my repeat prescription and the pharmacy have been good with getting the same brand for me. I take mine in the morning and have mild sweats in the evening but are getting less just lately. No bone or joint pain and not really noticed mood swings. As at menopause age would probably be going through the same thing anyway. Good luck Tracey x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Signed and shared Thanks for bringing it to our attention.  Shouldn't need to be doing this. Diabolical.
Posts.Title: petition the government to continue Kadcyla for breast cancer patients...

Posts.Content: Hi Balmy Girl. I have just been for my 14th radiotherapy. I have had a cold and bad cough that's also gone onto my chest making breathing difficult. I was dreading having to lie flat on my back with my arms above my head last week. The staff were very good. They told me if I needed to cough then I could, but not to bring my hands down to cover my mouth. They think I have a chest infection now so they have arranged for me to see a doctor at my last session tomorrow. Will also get my feet checked as my big toe nails are very painful swollen and weepy. If you can get yourself there they will assess you. You have a 15 min chat with them before treatment starts or you could ring to see if they can change your start date. Sounds like you need to see a doctor if your cough has lasted a few weeks. Hope you get something sorted. Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy and bad cough and cold

Posts.Content: Well said Lynn. Me too. Mine is at the brillo pad stage and I'm thankfull when having a hot flush. Tracey x
Posts.Title: Curious about when my hair will fall out.

Posts.Content: Hi. I was on FEC-T and my hair started coming out in handfuls by day 12. I shaved it on day 15 as was very thin. The short hair was easier to deal with over the next few days on my pillow and in the shower.  I was expecting to be shiny bald but kept a fine layer on top and a little round the side. My underarm hair and leg hair just stopped growing.  My head hair started to grow back on 2nd cycle of T but nothing else yet except my beard lol. Almost 3 weeks post chemo now. I don't like wearing my wig as it's hot and itchy. I don't usually wear anything unless it's freezing then I have some lovely crochet hats my daughter made. I decided that I didn't care what people thought of me. Do what is comfortable for you. Hold your head up high, think positive thoughts and you will be finished before you know it. Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Curious about when my hair will fall out.

Posts.Content: Hi Janette.  Sounds like a good plan. My husband was the same. I have always washed and condition my little bit of hair and scalp with simple products and have had no problems.  On the plus side, it's a lot quicker to get ready to go out now.  I forget about my hair until I look on the mirror but I know inside I'm still me no matter what I look like. I start radiotherapy on Monday. After the 1st chemo it seems to go quickly. Hope you feeling OK now.  Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Curious about when my hair will fall out.

Posts.Content: Hi all. Day 10 of 2nd fec-t and finally turned a corner. Feeling almost human again. My lovely husband took me out for lunch and a nice little walk. We found a lovely traditional sweetshop and bought some Pineapple chunks. Felt like a little girl again and taste lovely in my nasty mouth. My hair is almost all gone but it really doesn't seem to matter any more. Went out without wearing anything.  May sound silly but almost felt empowered and stronger. Feeling positive today.  Happy Sunday xxx Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Pineapple chunks - FEC

Posts.Content: I hope so too. Let us know know how it goes. Everyone is different so you maybe ok. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Pineapple chunks - FEC

Posts.Content: Thank you. Yes I'm realising now that you have to make the most of the good days. Good luck for Thursday. Are you starting T this time?  Tracey x
Posts.Title: Pineapple chunks - FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Alison. Mine started shedding about day 14. It was more itchy than painful. I had it shaved to no. 4 on day 18. It was bliss. Have lost most of it now but just had 3rd fec. And still got a small amount on top.  Went out like that straight away and am now confident enough to not care what others think. I have a lovely wig which I may wear a bit now it's getting colder and a basket full of hats and scarves  but have hardly worn them in this heat we have had. Good luck and do what is best for you. I felt very empowered. Hope you will too. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Sore/Tender Scalp

Posts.Content: Thank you Julia. Looking back and seeing how far I've come does help. Bit fed up of feeling ill now though so looking forward to the summer. Have my 1st appointment with GP on Monday. Not sure how that will go as haven't been for years. Just hope he will be sympathetic to all this treatment and ongoing side effects. I really want to go back to work but know I'm not ready yet xx
Posts.Title: Another box ticked

Posts.Content: Hi Kim My breast cancer was mixed dcis with ductal and lobular invasive grade 2. As it was all removed with clear margins I don't really dwell on it. I've had chemo and radiotherapy and am now having herceptin 3 weekly for 12 months and tamoxifen for 5 years as the tumor tested positive for her2 protein and oestrogen positive.  They may be testing for her2 as it does take longer for these results you come back. I was told the grade and type of cancer before surgery but didn't know it was invasive until I got the Pathology results afterwards. I think many people have dcis as well as an invasive ductal or lobular so try not to worry about the type. The main thing is that it has all been taken away. Good luck with the rest of your results.   Tracey x
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with 2 types of breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hello ladies.  Just ticked another box. Radiotherapy completed. No problems. Very light pink boob. Used 99% Aloe Vera gel all way through. Struggling with another nasty chest infection now so still feeling rubbish. Radiotherapy doctor was great. Gave me strong antibiotics and steroids which he said should help the infection around my horrid painful brown big toe nails as well. Still have 12 herceptin to go. Doctor recommended not starting my tamoxifen for another week when hopefully my infection has cleared and I can breath better.  Been quite a journey since my first mammogram back in March. Still find it hard to believe this has all happened. Can't wait to get my body back and some sort of normal.  Taking one day at a time really does get you through. Good luck to all you ladies at the beginning of your journey and thank you to the post treatment ladies for all your help. Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Another box ticked

Posts.Content: Hi I'm taking all my (never used) chemo scarves hats etc. to my local Maggies on Friday when I have my review with the breast surgeon. I noticed their was a box in the waiting room of the chemo Unit as well for donations.  Tracey x
Posts.Title: Squeezing some good out of this nasty disease

Posts.Content: Hi.  I have also been taking the wockhardt brand of tamoxifen for the past 2 years but have an appointment with oncologist next week.  They couldn't decide whether I should stay on Tamoxifen or change to letrozole after 2 years as chemo started my menopause.  I have fluey aches when I have had a busy day but mostly ok.  Not sure I want to change after reading about the side effects but I'll be 53 next week so think they may decide to.  Hope things improve for you xx
Posts.Title: Letrezol

Posts.Content: Hi.  I have also been taking the wockhardt brand of tamoxifen for the past 2 years but have an appointment with oncologist next week.  They couldn't decide whether I should stay on Tamoxifen or change to letrozole after 2 years as chemo started my menopause.  I have fluey aches when I have had a busy day but mostly ok.  Not sure I want to change after reading about the side effects but I'll be 53 next week so think they may decide to.  Hope things improve for you xx
Posts.Title: Letrezol

Posts.Content: Hi daisy 31 and pontypouch.  Looks like we are in this together.  I had my 1st one yesterday and am still on a high with the steroids.  My onc. Gave me cocodemol for the bone pain and a type of Imodium as she told me I'm more likely to get diarrhoea than constipation this time. No nausea so far this time. Just can't sleep yet and mild headache.  Can't even tell where the needle went In for the herceptin but not sure if that will get worse in time. Just got to take it one day at a time. Just making some meals with lots of good protein and veggies in for later in the week incase the Tax truck hits me.  Stay strong and keep in touch.  Cyber friend are the best. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: 1st Tax and Herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi Lindley.  Sorry you are struggling this time. I had low white cells but not on any injections. I think you may need to take some advice if you not getting any better.  I haven't had diarrhoea or the bone pain so far. I have the same symptoms as the FEC at the moment  (only on day 4) all pressure in My head and ears and can't focus or concentrate.  Really tired now the extra steroids have finished. I'm lucky as my children are grown up. Really feel for you with a young family.  Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: 1st Tax and Herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi Jill.  I had sentinal node removed in day surgery unit. I had the injection at the edge of my nipple in nuclear medicine unit then went for surgery about 2.00pm. They inject a blue dye which travels to the lymph node so the surgeon knows which one to remove. It was a quick surgery and I was on my way home by 6.30. Bit groggy but nothing like my main surgery to remove the cancer. It left a small scar line just sitting at the top of my bra under my arm. Not actually in the arm pit. No problems healed quickly. Almost forgotten I've had it now except my boob is still a bit blue (surgery was last june) luckily mine was clear so no spread. Just have to be careful lifting heavy things for a while. Good luck Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Sentinel Node surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Jeanette.  I'm having my last chemo tomorrow but will be thinking of you. Sending lots and lots of bear hugs and positive mental attitude. Shout out when you need us. Rest assured we will be here for you. Tracey xxxx
Posts.Title: I need help please.

Posts.Content: Hi. My nails have been good as well. I've kept them painted with opi nail envy and a dark colour since last August. When I take it off my nails are almost brown (like I've dipped them in tea leaves) also some are quite tender. Have only lost 1 toe nail. Finger nails just don't look pretty nut apart from being tender are still growing well and strong. Finished chemo in November and new part of nails looks OK. Hopefully you will not lose them. Just protect them with gloves when  cleaning and keep moisturising regularly. I noticed the brown ones were the most tender. Some are worse than others.  Good luck Tracey x
Posts.Title: Nails on 'T'

Posts.Content: 3 weeks. Finish on December 30th. Hopefully a better 2017 for us all xx Tracey xx
Posts.Title: ALMOST DONE!

Posts.Content: Hi Alison. Congratulations and very well done on completing your treatment plan. I'm nearly there. Had surgery x 2 and fec-t chemo. Start rads next week then 5 years tamoxifen with herceptin. Hope everything goes ok for your future  Best wishes Tracey xx
Posts.Title: ALMOST DONE!

Posts.Content: Hi Karen. I am er+ and her2 positive.  I finished chemo in November and radiotherapy on Wednesday. I have been prescribed tamoxifen. Wasn't given a choice. I was told that I was classed as peri menopausal as had been on and off with periods for 2 years. I was 50 on diagnosis in April. I had been having regular periods for 3 months leading up to diagnosis. My last one was in July.  Chemo started in August. Haven't had any since so assume ovaries have stopped working. I was told I would take tamoxifen for 5 years by bcn. Then oncologist told me I may change to letrozole after 2/3 years. Will start sometime next week.  just recovering from chest infection so doctors told me to wait a week to recover. Tamoxifen is good for not thinning bone.  Still don't understand why they gave you the choice. Surely they are the experts and we should be guided by them. I would ask a few more questions so you are happy with whichever you decide to take. Good luck x
Posts.Title: Choice of medication?

Posts.Content: Hi worried. I would think you are on the right one. I was told that to be classed as post menopausal you had to have not had a period for 2 years. Was you having any hot flushes or any other symptoms prior to diagnosis? If not you were probably peri menopausal and tamoxifen is the recommended drug . You should ask at your next appointment if you are at all concerned. It does seem that oncologist have different views.  Take care Tracey x
Posts.Title: Choice of medication?

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn. I'm also glad spring has sprung. Does make me feel better as well.  I'm still giving MRI scans for heart every 3 months whilst on herceptin.  As far as I know my follow up will be the same as you. Just yearly mammogram for 5 years. Not sure if I'll see oncologist annually or not whilst on tamoxifen. They did mention I might need to change to letrozole in a couple of years. Suppose I'll just have to wait and see as I didn't have any symptoms either. Just trying to be vigilant.  Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Back to work - another box ticked

Posts.Content: So after dodgy mammogram last March horrid biopsies and diagnosis for dcis in April, wle and double breast reduction in May invasive cancer found in Pathology report, SNB in June, chemo August to November with herceptin, radiotherapy in January and tamoxifen it's been quite a year. Couldn't see my Self feeling normal ever again but this week I have started back to work. It went really well and I actually felt like ME for the 1st time in ages.  Waiting for herceptin nurse to come and jab me now but even that feels OK as I'll have had more than I've got left after today (9 done and 8 left). To all of you starting treatment or going through it , you will get their. It took longer than I expected to get here but physically and emotionally feel so much better. Hang in there and good look to you all. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Back to work - another box ticked

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn.  My nails have been quite good. Tenderness nearly gone. No splits as yet but that may change when the 3 chemo ridges grow to the end of the nail. Still keep them painted as not very pretty to look at from half way up. Did you notice any difference in how you felt after herceptin had finished? Just wondering if I can look forward to another little boost come October.  I'm doing phased return over 4 weeks at work and so far it's fine.  Just waiting for 1st mammogram letter to arrive now and MRI heart scan. Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Back to work - another box ticked

Posts.Content: Thank you Von.  Anything to be comfortable.  Still a bit achey but  flushes aren't too bad.  I have worked for the same firm of solicitors  for 12 years but they have sold out to a larger firm since I've been off and will be training on a completely new computer software system. Slightly concerned as I still have a bit of chemo brain lol. Good job it's phased return as well. Glad your sorted with a new job.  Take care Tracey x
Posts.Title: Creams for vaginal dryness after ER+ BC

Posts.Content: Thank you Berren.  Will take a look tomorrow. Got a shiny new lady garden as well (4 months post chemo) so might help to have a bit of a trim as well.   Tracey x
Posts.Title: Creams for vaginal dryness after ER+ BC

Posts.Content: Hi I finished chemo in November and rads in January. I have had 8 herceptin and am on my 3rd month of tamoxifen. Side effects not too bad but am struggling with vaginal dryness outside and in. Is their any over the counter creams or moisturiser that are safe to use for er positive bc? I'm am aware that some menopause creams contain oestrogen and should be avoided. I am due to start back to work on Monday which is quite scarey after 10 months off and would like to be comfortable down below if possible.  Thank you Tracey
Posts.Title: Creams for vaginal dryness after ER+ BC

Posts.Content: Thanks Karen. Was hoping to avoid GP as it takes ages to get an appointment and am starting back to work next week but maybe that is the best thing to do. Really wasn't expecting to feel this sore. Definitely not nice. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Creams for vaginal dryness after ER+ BC

Posts.Content: Hi Jojo.  You can use any non alcohol based mouthwash if your mouth doesn't get sore. Just use it about 4 times per day. My oncologist prescribed Difflam mouthwash as I did have sore tongue and it was great as it didn't sting and was a nice taste when taste buds went awol. You can also use bicarbonate of soda or baking soda. I think it's a quarter teaspoon per glass of water. Hope this helps Tracey x
Posts.Title: Recipe for mouthwask

Posts.Content: Merry Christmas to you all. Hope 2017 is kinder to you all. I absolutely love Brussel sprouts Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Xmas

Posts.Content: Hi. Maybe worth changing brands if things don't improve over next few weeks. I'm on Wockhardt brand and apart from very mild sweats in the evenings I'm mostly fine. My pharmacy are very good at making sure I get the same brand every month. We are all different and some people have problems with brands others are fine with. I tend to get heart burn a lot so take lansoprazole which really helps. Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & bone aches

Posts.Content: You are an inspiration LondonLass.  Thank you. I am thankful for many things. First and formost the NHS. Breast screening surgery chemo rads and ht of which I'm eternally grateful. Never thought it would be such a rollercoaster. New treatment plan at each appointment. Bring it on i said. Let's do this. Let's get rid of the nasties once and for all. I truly believed that this was doable. It was a massive shock but I decided right there and then that I couldn't changed it so I will deal with it. Few down days but mostly positive. After all I'm a wife of 30 years a mum to 2 amazing grown up children and a mamma to 2 beautiful granddaughters. I'm the one who does the "looking after" stuff. I had to do it for them. I give thanks everyday for my family. I also thank the NHS for giving me back my husband who suffered a cardiac arrest aged just 49, whilst driving home from work. They kept him alive for me for 2 weeks until he was strong enough to come back to us. He's almost as good as new. I thank you ladies from the bottom of my heart for the help and advice. Almost normalised the situation for me. I also would like to thank my 2 granddaughters for accepting and loving me unconditionally when my long blond hair fell out and they very softly cuddled me and stroked my very sparsely covered head. Aged 2 and 5 this was the most important thing for me.  For 2017 I would like my body to be as well as my mind thinks it is (and be slightly smaller than it is now - thanks steroids lol) Get back to work and some kind of normal.  Go to my sons wedding in May with enough hair to look half decent on the wedding pics. And thank my family and friends for being amazing. Wishing you all a very Merry Christmas and a healthy new year. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Two thanks and a Wish...

Posts.Content: Hi TootsBess. Congratulations for finishing Chemo. I didn't use cold cap do lost most of my hair except a fine layer on top. It stopped coming out after 3rd fec. Started growing during T and have a full head now. (Look like an action man hair cut lol).  Not sure what to say regarding fatigue. 3 weeks is still early days for you. As chemo side effects seem to be accumulative you have to give your body chance to recover. Bloods my still be low as well.  I finished chemo 13 weeks ago and radiotherapy 7 weeks ago and also expected to spring back to previous cancer days. I am still struggling with everyday things. Having herceptin and tamoxifen now so maybe this isn't helping. I can only do half what I used to do before I ache like I've got flu and feel nausea on and off. Don't know how I'm going to cope going back to work.  Someone else further along this road may be able to advise us both. Don't be hard on yourself and listen to your body. Take care  Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Post Chemo Fatigue and Hair!

Posts.Content: Hi. I used the moisturiser just the same on rest days as treatment days. I had a 4 day break over Christmas but I think the skin keeps cooking lol. Kept on after treatment for about 3 weeks but now just do it once a day. No problems at all. Skin just went slightly pink then brown. I used aloe Vera gel. Never had anything placed on my chest during treatment though. Just unzipped the gown got zapped then got dressed. Hope it works out well for you xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy questions

Posts.Content: Hi all.  Having 5th chemo this week 2nd T. Side effects for me on 1st Tax have been the same as fec except no nausea.  Mainly pressure in head eyes and ears and really really bad nasty taste constantly in mouth.  Seems like tongue is producing poison especially when I eat. Not much bone pain or tummy problems.  I have noticed I am more breathless now and am much more tired  (even though I only sleep about 6.5 hours each nignt) I seem to need rest more than sleep. When I had my last MRI scan on heart before herceptin started my LVE had dropped. Could this be why I'm more breathless?  Still have a fine layer of hair on top of head. Armpit hair and leg hair just stopped growing. Eye lashes still ok but eyebrows very thin. Nails are still long and strong. Kept them painted and moisture cuticles daily. Have developed a bright red patch of skin on the back of my hand about the size of 10 pence piece. Looks like a burn but is almost numb to touch. Any ideas what this might be. Can't believe no 5 is almost here. Can't wait to feel fit and well again and get rid of this extra weight. This fatigue thing is very debilitating. Definitely not the same as being tired. Trying to keep positive. Managing it most of the time. Hope everyone else is doing ok.  Onwards and upwards Tracey xx
Posts.Title: 2nd T this week. How is everyone else doing ?

Posts.Content: Hi Paula.  Woooo hoooo.  Last one. Climbing the ladder. Soon be at the top. Yes I've also got rads after chemo and herceptin for 12 months and tamoxifen. Glad you haven't suffered to badly.  The taste this is awful I know. Mine doesn't go away at all know. It's a real pain with everything tasting so bad even water and still gaining weight. Hope all goes well for your last one. Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: 2nd T this week. How is everyone else doing ?

Posts.Content: Hi Lindsey.  Good luck for Wednesday.  Hope your 2nd T is kinder to you. Nearly there. Take care  Tracey xx
Posts.Title: 2nd T this week. How is everyone else doing ?

Posts.Content: Hi thanks for that Lynn.  I'm on my way now. Have mild asthma so just been using puffer a bit more. I'm ok pottering at home just when I do more than one flight of stairs I'm struggling.  Also dragging extra weight around doesn't help.  Bit of a catch 22. Doing as much as I can and watching what I eat but still gaining weight. Never mind. Only 2 more to go. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: 2nd T this week. How is everyone else doing ?

Posts.Content: Hi Maria.  I have kept a chemo diary since day one of treatment. I write my temperature each morning and track my side effects and some feelings every day. This helps to look back on when you have each round and see when you are likely to be feeling good or not so good. Makes planning easier as well and I have chemo brain so is also helpful when I can't remember things. I also write my Meds. Down so I know I've taken everything at the write time.  This works for me. Hope everything works out for you.  I found it much easier to deal with once the treatment plan was in place so hopefully you will feel the same. Take care Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Keep a diary

Posts.Content: Hi Nic. I had a lumpectomy and double breast reduction. My surgeon suggested this would be the best way of removing the cancer and conserving the natural breast. I was an E cup and my cancer was low down near the bra wire in the middle of my breast. He said it was the piece they would remove if I had chosen to have a reduction so I had the same surgery on both sides. I am now a D cup. Your surgeon will give you advice on what is best for you but make a list of the questions you would like to ask. I had my surgery in may and am now almost half way through fec-t. Good luck with your appointment this week. Tracey xx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy with breast reduction - when might this be offered?

Posts.Content: Hi Marie. I'm 3 weeks into my 1st pack of tamoxifen. I have also been told to stick to the same brand for 2 or 3 months to see how I go. I took my repeat prescription into boots and told them I need the same brand. (Mine is wockhardt). They were very good and put a sticker on the supply they have with my name on so when my prescription is returned from GP I will have the same brand. They told me to remind them each time I take my repeat in and they will make sure I keep the same brand. Maybe worth having a chat with your local pharmacy xx
Posts.Title: Does a change in brand of tamoxifen make any difference please?

Posts.Content: Hi my brand of tamoxifen is wockhardt UK.  I'm due to start taking it tomorrow. Anyone else on this brand and how do you find it? Feeling good that everything else is behind me but nervous of what's to come. Thanks Tracey x
Posts.Title: Different manufacturer of anastrozole
